result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Gracia

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Gracia in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Jesus Gracia.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel informed the Court this case may be in Deferred Prosecution Agreement posture. Defendant has scheduled a TAD evaluation. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesus Gracia in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Jesus Gracia.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Attorney Ertl was recently appointed, and has received discovery. Defense is requesting additional time to review materials. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jesus Gracia in court. Prosecuting attorney Lukas Jaeger, under the student practice rule, along with Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/8/22 @ 2:30p
